paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $5,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: The assets of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (4)(b) and (4A), shall, except where the Registrar is satisfied as regards the scheme in the manner described in section 18(4)(b)(ii), be kept separate and distinct from and shall not form part of the assets of the relevant employer of the scheme or the assets of the administrator of the scheme which are not vested in him in his capacity as such; (Amended 59 of 1993 s. 22; 53 of 1995 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not be subject to any assignment, charge, pledge or other encumbrance except—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the trust (if any) governing the scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any charge or pledge created for the purposes of securing loans necessary for meeting the liabilities of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any option to acquire for valuable consideration any interest in the assets of the scheme granted in the normal course of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall only be applied for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.content: Any assignment, charge, pledge or other encumbrance created over the assets of a registered scheme shall be void to the extent to which the creation contravenes subsection (1).

Where the net realizable value of the assets of a registered scheme exceeds the aggregate past service liability and the terms of the scheme provide for repayment of the excess or any part thereof to the relevant employer of the scheme in such circumstances, nothing in this section shall be construed as preventing such repayment.

subsection.leadIn: Where a registered scheme is the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notwithstanding—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the terms of the scheme (including of that arrangement);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the other provisions of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the provisions of any other enactment; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any rule of law,

paragraph.continued: the assets or estate of the relevant employer of the scheme available for distribution in the event of the bankruptcy or winding up of that employer shall not include so much of the assets of that scheme as equals the aggregate past service liability of the members of that scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subsection (1)(a) shall not operate to either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: prevent the relevant employer of the scheme from being the policy holder of the policy issued by the authorized insurer concerned under that arrangement; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: require any claim which may be made against that insurer under that arrangement to be kept separate and distinct from and not form part of the assets of that employer. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 22)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: Where a registered scheme is a participating scheme of a pooling agreement accepted under section 2(5), the asset separation required under subsection (1)(a) does not require the separation of the assets of the scheme from the assets of the other schemes vested in the administrator in his capacity as administrator of the pooling agreement. (Added 53 of 1995 s. 13)

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the operation of subsection (4)(a) in relation to a registered scheme shall not prejudice the operation of subsection (1)(c) in relation to so much of the assets of that scheme as are not, by virtue of that first-mentioned subsection, included in the assets or estate of the relevant employer of the scheme available for distribution in the event of the bankruptcy or winding up of that employer. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 22)

The relevant employer concerned shall notify the Registrar of a change of the relevant employer of a registered scheme together with the matters prescribed in rules made by the Registrar within 1 month of the change.
The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall give notice of the matters prescribed in rules made by the Registrar within 1 month after the change to the name of the scheme.

The relevant employer of a registered scheme who without reasonable excuse fails to notify the Registrar of a change as required under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 18)

A relevant employer of a registered scheme who without reasonable excuse fails to give the Registrar notice of the prescribed matters within the prescribed time of a change to the name of the scheme under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 1. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any change of his name or address which was previously supplied to the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any change of the administrator of the scheme,

subsection.continued: within 1 month of such change.

subsection.leadIn: The designated person of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must, within 1 month of any change of the following information previously supplied to the Registrar, notify the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: the name or address of the designated person;
the name or address of the administrator of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the designated person or administrator of the scheme is a body corporate, must within the specified period, notify the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: if its domicile is changed to Hong Kong so that it becomes a company registered under section 820C(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) (Cap. 622)—such change in domicile; or
if its domicile is changed to a place other than Hong Kong—such change in domicile and its latest place of domicile. (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 227)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)(b)—
subsection.def: specified period (指明期間)—(a)in relation to a change in domicile to Hong Kong—means 1 month after the designated person or administrator of the registered scheme is deregistered as required by section 820E(3)(a) of Cap. 622; or(b)in relation to a change in domicile to a place other than Hong Kong—means 1 month after the completion of the change. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 227)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Cessation of application of pooling agreement

subsection.content: A pooling agreement shall not cease to apply to a registered scheme unless the Registrar has given his prior consent in writing.
A pooling agreement shall, notwithstanding any term of it, be construed and have effect as if it was made subject to subsection (1).

The Registrar may give consent referred to in subsection (1) on an application in writing made to him by the administrator of the relevant pooling agreement or the relevant employer of the relevant registered scheme.
Where a pooling agreement ceases to apply to a registered scheme, the administrator of the scheme shall within 14 days inform the Registrar in writing of such cessation.

Where a registered scheme is a participating scheme of a pooling agreement upon its registration, the registration shall cease to have effect upon the cessation of application of that agreement to the scheme.
Any person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the assets of a registered scheme shall be sufficient to meet its aggregate vested liability and such a scheme shall be funded in accordance with the terms of the scheme and (where the scheme is a defined benefit scheme) recommendations, if any, contained in an actuarial certificate supplied under section 15 and certifying in the manner described in paragraph 1 or 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 or an actuarial certificate supplied under section 31 and certifying in the manner described in Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 2.

If a scheme existing immediately before 15 October 1993 becomes a registered scheme, it shall be the duty of the relevant employer of the scheme to provide in accordance with subsection (3) the resources necessary to enable the scheme to meet both its aggregate vested liability and its aggregate past service liability on the respective days on which the periods referred to in subsection (3) expire. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: The resources referred to in subsection (2) shall be provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as they relate to the relevant registered scheme’s aggregate vested liability, not later than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the expiration of the period of 5 years after the commencement* of section 1; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such shorter period as may be agreed on by the relevant employer and administrator of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: such longer period as the Registrar may allow in accordance with rules made for the purposes of this paragraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in so far as they relate to such scheme’s aggregate past service liability, not later than the expiration of such period as may be agreed on between such employer and such administrator.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any provision of the terms of an occupational retirement scheme, such terms shall be construed and have effect as though they were made subject to this section.

section.name: s24A
section.heading: Recovery of arrears in relation to certain registered schemes

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: arrears (欠款), in relation to a contribution payable to the funds of a scheme by a relevant employer, means so much of the contribution as has not been paid by that employer when it became due;

relevant scheme (有關計劃) means a registered scheme in respect of which the members or a class of members and their employer are exempted under section 5 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485).

subsection.leadIn: If any arrears arise in respect of a relevant scheme, the Registrar may, in accordance with rules made under section 73 for the purpose, impose on the relevant employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a financial penalty that does not exceed the greater of $5,000 and an amount equal to 10 per cent of the arrears; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a requirement to pay a contribution surcharge at a rate prescribed by rules in force under section 73, not exceeding 20 per cent per annum of the arrears.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, by proceedings brought in a court of competent jurisdiction in Hong Kong, recover as a debt due to the Registrar any arrears payable by the relevant employer under this section, and any financial penalty or contribution surcharge imposed in respect of those arrears under subsection (2).

In any proceedings brought under subsection (3), a certificate, purporting to be signed by the Registrar, specifying the amount of any arrears, or of any financial penalty or contribution surcharge imposed in respect of those arrears under subsection (2), is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the matters specified in the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: If arrears arise in respect of a relevant scheme, the designated person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take reasonable steps to recover the arrears; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give notice in writing to the Registrar setting out particulars of the arrears, the scheme and the relevant employer to enable or assist the Registrar to perform any functions imposed on him by this section or rules made under section 73 for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on receipt of a notice referred to in subsection (5)(b), give notice in writing to the relevant employer, accompanied by a copy of this section in the Chinese and English languages, requesting him to pay the arrears on or before a date specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant employer does not comply with the request, take steps to recover the arrears and any financial penalty and contribution surcharge imposed under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The designated person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assist the Registrar to discharge the duty referred to in subsection (6)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: verify the calculation of any amount received from the relevant employer in payment of the arrears or any contribution surcharge imposed under subsection (2).

subsection.content: The Registrar shall pay to the designated person any amount received from the relevant employer in payment of the arrears or any contribution surcharge imposed under subsection (2).
The designated person shall pay into the scheme any amount referred to in subsection (7)(b).

The Registrar shall give notice in writing to the Authority, within the meaning of section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), setting out particulars of the arrears, the scheme and the relevant employer to enable or assist the Authority to perform a function referred to in section 78(1)(ea).

A designated person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on designated persons by this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: EmployerTrustee
def.leadIn: employer trustee (僱主受託人) in relation to a trust means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant employer of the registered scheme which is governed by the trust;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an associate, not being a registered trust company, of such employer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee of such employer,

def.continued: when acting in the capacity of a trustee of the trust;

subsection.def: non-employer trustee (非僱主受託人) in relation to a trust means a trustee who is not an employer trustee.

subsection.leadIn: Where a registered scheme is governed by a trust—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sole trustee of the trust shall not be an employer trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the trust instrument provides for the appointment of 2 or more trustees, there shall be appointed for the time being at least 1 non-employer trustee.

subsection.leadIn: Where a registered scheme is a Hong Kong domiciled scheme and governed by a trust, the relevant trust instrument shall be construed and have effect as if the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: required the appointment of at least 1 non-employer trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provided that in case all non-employer trustees cease to be trustees at a time when there was an employer trustee, at least 1 new non-employer trustee should be appointed as soon as reasonably practicable,

subsection.continued: if the instrument does not so require or provide.

subsection.content: A non-employer trustee appointed by virtue of subsection (3) shall for all purposes be regarded as having been appointed under the relevant trust instrument.

subsection.leadIn: A trustee of a registered scheme must perform the following duties with respect to the administration of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the duty to exercise a level of care, skill, diligence and prudence that may reasonably be expected of a prudent person who is acting in a similar capacity and who is familiar with the administration, management and maintenance of a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: the duty to put the interests of the members of the scheme before the trustee’s own interest; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the duty to act in accordance with the terms of the scheme. (Added 9 of 2020 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if any requirement of section 25(2) or (5) is not complied with in relation to a registered scheme, the Registrar may at any time require the relevant employer of the scheme or the trustee (or, if there be more than 1 trustee, any of them) by notice in writing— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to take such steps as are necessary to ensure compliance with the requirement as regards the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to inform him whether such steps have been taken,

subsection.continued: within a period specified by the Registrar.

subsection.content: The Registrar may extend the period referred to in subsection (1) on application in writing by the relevant employer or the trustee (or, if there be more than 1 trustee, any of them). (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: A requirement shall not be made under subsection (1) as regards a registered scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application for the registration of the scheme was allowed under section 18(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions prescribed in section 18(4) are fulfilled as regards the scheme for the time being.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MutualFundCorporation
def.leadIn: mutual fund corporation (互惠基金法團) means a corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is or holds itself out as being engaged primarily in the business of investing, reinvesting or trading in securities or any other property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the shares in which are exclusively, or primarily, redeemable shares; (Added 53 of 1995 s. 16)

def.name: RestrictedInvestment
def.leadIn: restricted investment (受限制投資項目) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any security of, or issued by, the relevant employer of a registered scheme or an associate of such employer except security issued by an associate of such employer in the form of an option which if exercised will constitute investment in the share capital of a body corporate other than the relevant employer or an associate of such employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any security in the form of an option which if exercised will constitute investment in the share capital of the relevant employer of a registered scheme or an associate of such employer.

subsection.leadIn: Where an occupational retirement scheme is registered under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not more than 10% of the assets of the scheme shall consist of restricted investments; (Replaced 53 of 1995 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no asset of the scheme shall consist of a loan to the relevant employer of the scheme or an associate of the relevant employer; (Replaced 53 of 1995 s. 16)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), no asset of the scheme acquired on or after 15 October 1993 shall consist of investments in the share capital of a body corporate which share capital is not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: listed on a recognized stock market as defined in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: publicly listed on a specified stock exchange as defined in that section. (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(c) shall not operate to prohibit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: up to but not exceeding 15% of the assets of the scheme consisting of investments in the share capital of bodies corporate which share capital is publicly listed on a stock exchange legally established and regulated as a stock exchange in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is established and which is other than the stock exchanges referred to in subsection (2)(c) (which 15% is not in addition to any investments of the same nature held prior to 15 October 1993 and exempted from the restriction of subsection (2)(c));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assets of the scheme consisting of investments in redeemable shares in a mutual fund corporation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: investments that derive directly from entitlements attached to investments held prior to 15 October 1993 or acquired as a result of this paragraph and which would otherwise be prohibited by subsection (2)(c) about which investments the administrator, before making the investments, shall obtain the Registrar’s permission to make the investments by satisfying the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: that the investments have become available in the normal course of business; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the registered scheme would be disadvantaged if the investments were not made. (Replaced 53 of 1995 s. 16)

subsection.content: The Registrar may give guidelines as to what evidence or documentary material would be relevant to the issue of satisfying him of the matters set out in subsection (3)(c) including the requirement that the evidence and documentary materials be verified by independent advisors specified by the Registrar. (Replaced 53 of 1995 s. 16)
The Registrar is not liable for any loss incurred by a scheme as a result of an investment made with his permission under subsection (3)(c). (Replaced 53 of 1995 s. 16)

In determining at any time whether the requirement of subsection (2) is complied with assets shall be valued at their market value or, where such value cannot be ascertained, the net realizable value, at that time.

Where the Registrar reasonably believes that the requirement of subsection (2) is for the time being not being complied with as regards a registered scheme, he may, having regard to the interests of the members of the scheme as a whole, by notice in writing to the administrator of the scheme require him to ensure compliance with the requirement as regards the scheme within such period as the Registrar reasonably considers necessary (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice).

A notice under subsection (7) relating to a registered scheme shall state that representations as regards the requirement specified in the notice may be made in writing to the Registrar within such period as is specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice) by or on behalf of the administrator of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where a representation relating to a requirement is made in accordance with this section, the Registrar, having had regard to such representation, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw or modify the requirement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extend the period referred to in subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall pay to the Registrar in respect of that scheme a prescribed fee which is a periodic fee as may be appropriate in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each period of 12 months during which the scheme continues to be a registered scheme and beginning on the first or any subsequent anniversary of its registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: part of such a period.

subsection.content: A periodic fee payable under subsection (1) shall be paid to the Registrar not later than 1 month after the first day of the period in respect of which it is payable.

Where a periodic fee is not paid in accordance with subsection (2), there shall be chargeable upon the unpaid fee a surcharge equal to the amount of such unpaid fee which shall be paid together with such unpaid fee to the Registrar not later than 2 months after the first day of the period in respect of which the unpaid fee is payable.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Termination and winding up to be notified

subsection.content: Where a registered scheme is terminated or otherwise wound up (except in pursuance to a court order under section 48), the relevant employer and designated person of the scheme shall within 14 days of the commencement of the winding up or termination process give a notice in writing of that fact to the Registrar and each member of the scheme.
Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Within 6 months after the end of a registered scheme’s financial year or such longer period as the Registrar may in his absolute discretion allow, the designated person of the scheme shall send to the Registrar— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an annual return for that year as regards the scheme in such form and containing such information as may be specified by the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (where section 20(5) applies to the scheme by virtue of a resolution passed under paragraph (c) of that section) a copy of the relevant resolution certified by the administrator of the scheme to be a true copy; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (where section 20(5) does not apply to the scheme) a copy of the financial statements of the scheme for that year audited under section 20(1) and a copy of the auditor’s report containing the information referred to in section 20(3).

subsection.leadIn: Within 1 month after the end of a financial year of a registered scheme, or a longer period the Registrar may allow, the relevant employer of the scheme must give the Registrar a written statement as to whether at all times during the financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheme by its terms limits membership of the scheme to eligible persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all members of the scheme are eligible persons. (Added 9 of 2020 s. 22)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Periodic certification of registered defined benefit schemes

subsection.content: The designated person of a registered scheme which is a defined benefit scheme shall, as regards each successive period of 3 years or such shorter period as the Registrar may specify in rules made by him, from the date of the actuarial review giving rise to the most recent actuarial certificate supplied as regards the scheme to the Registrar in accordance with this Ordinance, within 6 months after the expiration of the period or such later time as the Registrar may in his absolute discretion allow, supply to the Registrar a certificate issued by an actuary which shall either be a full certificate or a qualified certificate.

The full certificate or qualified certificate referred to in subsection (1) shall be prepared in accordance with Schedule 2 and shall contain such other information as the Registrar may specify in rules made under section 73(1)(i).

subsection.leadIn: Where at the time when the application for the registration of an occupational retirement scheme is made, or at any time thereafter, a qualified certificate is supplied to the Registrar as regards a scheme, the following provisions shall apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), subsection (1) shall operate as regards the scheme as though the reference therein to each successive period of 3 years was substituted by a reference to each period of 1 year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may by notice in writing require the administrator of the scheme to supply to him within the period specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice) a report by an actuary on such matters as the Registrar may specify in the notice.

subsection.content: Where the Registrar receives a qualified certificate as regards a registered scheme and he subsequently receives a full certificate as regards that scheme, subsection (3) shall cease to apply as regards the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after a written request is made of him by the actuary preparing a certificate under this section as regards the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the actuary and such other person as may be authorized by that actuary to have access to such books and records of the employer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give to the actuary such information and explanations,

subsection.continued: as he may reasonably require for the purposes of discharging his duty in relation to the scheme.

subsection.content: An employer who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Registrar may require certain reports and certificates

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: receives as regards a registered scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a qualified certificate under section 31;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a written request from a consultative committee formed by the members of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a written request signed by not less than 20% or 100, whichever is less, of the members of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonably believes that there exist or existed circumstances which may prejudice the interests of any member of a registered scheme under the scheme,

subsection.continued: he may make a requirement described in subsection (2) of the designated person of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A requirement referred to in subsection (1) shall be contained in a notice in writing requiring the relevant designated person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: (where the scheme is a defined benefit scheme) to cause to be issued by an actuary approved by the Registrar a certificate in such form as is specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and to supply to the Registrar the report or certificate when prepared or issued or, in case such actuary refuses to issue such certificate, to notify the Registrar in writing of the refusal, within such period as is specified in the notice (being a period not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice).

subsection.content: The Registrar may in his absolute discretion extend the period specified in a notice under this section if he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar receives a report or certificate referred to in subsection (2), he may supply to the relevant employer of the relevant registered scheme a copy of such report or certificate and by notice in writing require him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make the copy available for inspection by the members of the scheme in such manner as shall be specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to inform, in a manner specified in the notice, such members that the report or certificate is available for inspection by them.

subsection.content: Any employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (4) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: The Registrar may, in performing any function under this Ordinance, take into account any report or certificate received under this section. (Added 9 of 2020 s. 23)
Nothing in section 77 shall be construed as affecting any provision of this section.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Information etc. to be given to Registrar

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by written notice require a person to give, within the period specified in the notice, any of the following information or documents relating to a registered scheme that is in the person’s possession or under the person’s control— (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not on the date of such notice the requirement of section 27(2) was complied with as regards the scheme and, if it was not complied with, particulars of all the restricted investments which on that date formed the whole or part of the assets of that scheme and the proportion of the market value or, where such value cannot be ascertained, the net realizable value of those investments to the market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value of the scheme’s assets as a whole;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such information as is specified in the notice and which relates to any accounts or records kept under section 20(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other information or document which is of a class or description specified in the notice and relates to the scheme or the pooling agreement (if any) which applies to the scheme.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by written notice require a person to give, within the period specified in the notice, any information or document (including a legal opinion, or an auditor’s certificate, on a matter specified by the Registrar) relating to a registered scheme that is reasonably required to enable the Registrar to determine whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheme by its terms limits membership of the scheme to eligible persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all members of the scheme are eligible persons. (Added 9 of 2020 s. 24)

subsection.content: The Registrar may in his absolute discretion extend the period specified in a notice under this section if he thinks fit.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Registrar to be notified of certain events

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ReportableEvent
def.leadIn: reportable event (須申報事件) means, in relation to a registered scheme, the occurrence of any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 20 is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 20A(1), (2) or (3) is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 21 is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 24 is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 25 is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a requirement under section 26(1) is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 27 is not complied with for the scheme;
the requirement of section 70B is not complied with for the scheme;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any term of the scheme allows a person other than an eligible person to be a member of the scheme;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: not all members of the scheme are eligible persons;

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

subsection.leadIn: If the relevant employer or administrator of a registered scheme becomes aware of a reportable event that occurs on or after the date* on which the Occupational Retirement Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (9 of 2020) comes into operation, the relevant employer or administrator must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: keep a record of the particulars of the event;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: permit the Registrar to inspect the record at any reasonable time during ordinary business hours; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: give written notice to the Registrar setting out such further or better particulars of the event as the Registrar requires as soon as practicable after the Registrar makes the requirement.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.
Where a registered scheme has more than 20 members, the majority of the members of the scheme may select amongst themselves members of a consultative committee.
The function of a consultative committee is to advise the administrator of the relevant registered scheme as regards the scheme.

The consultative committee constituted in respect of a registered scheme shall as soon as reasonably practicable after its constitution give a notice in writing of its constitution to the administrator and relevant employer of the scheme.
Where a member of a consultative committee ceases to be a member of the relevant registered scheme, he shall at the same time cease to be a member of the committee.

The relevant employer and the administrator of a registered scheme shall each be entitled to attend personally, or to nominate a person to attend on his behalf, at each meeting of the committee formed by the members of the scheme.

Any advice given by the committee shall be sent to the relevant employer who shall forward it to the administrator of the scheme and any advice so forwarded shall be considered by, but shall not be binding on, such administrator.

Where the condition referred to in subsection (1) ceases to be fulfilled as regards a registered scheme, the consultative committee formed in respect of the scheme shall on such cessation be dissolved.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Certain information to be made available to consultative committees or members of registered schemes

subsection.content: The designated person of a registered scheme shall as soon as reasonably practicable prepare and keep revised as circumstances require a statement containing the information set out in Schedule 3.

subsection.leadIn: Where a consultative committee has been formed by the members of a registered scheme, the designated person of the scheme shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable give to the committee a copy of the statement prepared under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (4), on a written request made to him by the committee, as soon as reasonably practicable furnish in writing to it the following particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the latest available aggregate market value of the scheme’s total assets;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not on the date of the request the requirement of section 27(2) was complied with as regards the scheme and, if it was not complied with, the particulars of all the restricted investments which formed the whole or part of the assets of the scheme on that date and the proportion of the market value or, where such value cannot be ascertained, the aggregate net realizable value of those investments to the aggregate market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value of the scheme’s total assets as a whole as on such date; (Amended 53 of 1995 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if on the date of the request the market value or, where such value cannot be ascertained, the net realizable value of a particular security then forming part of the scheme’s assets exceeded 10% of the market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value on such date of the scheme’s assets as a whole, the particulars of such security and the percentage it then formed of that market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value; and (Amended 53 of 1995 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if on the date of the request the market value or, if the market value cannot be ascertained, the net realizable value, of investments in the share capital of bodies corporate under section 27(3)(a) then forming part of the scheme’s assets exceeded 5% of the market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value on that date of the scheme’s assets as a whole, the particulars of the investments and the percentage they then formed of the market value or (where appropriate) the net realizable value. (Added 53 of 1995 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), if no consultative committee is formed by the members of a registered scheme, the designated person of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall permit any member of the scheme to inspect the statement prepared under subsection (1) or a copy thereof at any time during business hours at a place agreed on between the relevant employer of the scheme and a representative of the members of the scheme or in default of such agreement, at a place determined by the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, upon a written request by a member of the scheme and production by such member of a resolution passed in accordance with rules made by the Registrar by a majority of over 50% of the members of the scheme that such request is supported by such members, furnish as soon as reasonably practicable in writing to the member the particulars referred to in subsection (2)(b).

subsection.content: Where a request under subsection (2)(b) or (3)(b) is made of a designated person and is complied with, unless otherwise directed in writing by the Registrar, the designated person shall not be obliged to comply with a further such request until the period of 12 months beginning on the day on which the earlier request was received has expired.

subsection.leadIn: Within 6 months after the end of a registered scheme’s financial year, the relevant employer of the scheme shall give to each member of the scheme a statement of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s vested benefits under the scheme as at the end of that year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the benefits the member could reasonably expect to receive under the scheme on his retirement in respect of qualifying service already rendered.

subsection.content: Where a member of a registered scheme ceases to be employed under the employment to which the scheme relates, the relevant employer of the scheme shall, on a request in writing made by such member, not later than 3 months after such cessation, furnish to him particulars of any benefit under the scheme on such cessation of the member.

Where a registered scheme is amended, the administrator of the scheme shall as soon as reasonably practicable by notice in writing furnish the relevant employer of the scheme with particulars of the amendment and on receipt of such notice the employer shall give a copy of it to each member of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall, on a request in writing by any member of the scheme, furnish as soon as reasonably practicable to the member in writing the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a scheme governed by a trust, the names and addresses of all the trustees or, in case the scheme is the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement, the name and address of the relevant insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an offshore scheme, the name and address of the designated person of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in case a consultative committee is formed by the members in respect of the scheme, the names and addresses of its members.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant employer of a registered scheme shall give to each member of the scheme a statement containing the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the criteria and conditions of membership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how members’ contributions are calculated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: how employer’s contributions are calculated;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: what benefits are payable under the scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: how such benefits are calculated;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the conditions on which the benefits are paid;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: which benefits (if any) are payable on a discretionary basis.

subsection.leadIn: A statement required to be given under subsection (9) shall be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the member first became a member on or before the date of registration of the scheme) within 2 months after such date of registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the member first became a member after the date of registration of the scheme) within 2 months after the date on which the member first became a member.

subsection.content: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (2), (3), (5), (6), (7), (8) or (9) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

Nothing in subsection (1) or (2) shall be construed as requiring a designated person to specify or otherwise furnish particulars regarding any particular security or other property or the benefits (or any of them) to which a particular member of a registered scheme is entitled or prospectively entitled under the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: appointed person (獲委任人) means a person appointed under subsection (2);
matter under inquiry (查訊中的事情) means a matter specified under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a requirement relating to a registered scheme made under section 32 is not complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report is supplied to the Registrar under section 32 and, having regard to the report, he considers it appropriate so to do,

subsection.continued: the Registrar may appoint a person to conduct an inquiry as regards the scheme.

subsection.content: The Registrar may specify matters to which an inquiry under this section is to relate either at the time when an appointment is made under subsection (2) or at any later time.

Where the Registrar makes an appointment under subsection (2) as regards a registered scheme, he shall as soon as reasonably practicable give a notice in writing of the appointment and of the matter under inquiry to the relevant employer and designated person of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where an appointed person reasonably believes a person has in his possession or under his control any document which is likely to contain information relevant to the registered scheme or matter under inquiry, he may by notice in writing require that person to— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: attend before the appointed person at the time and place specified in the notice and answer truthfully and to the best of his ability such question relating to the scheme or matter under inquiry as the appointed person may put to him; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: give to the appointed person all assistance in connection with the inquiry which he is reasonably able to give.

subsection.content: Subject to section 76, where an appointed person makes a requirement of a person under subsection (5), the latter shall comply with the requirement.

An appointed person may examine on oath any person of whom a requirement is made under subsection (5)(b) or (c) provided he has first informed that person of the limitation imposed under subsection (8).

Subject to section 76 a person shall be obliged to answer a question put to him under this section by the appointed person, but neither the question nor the answer shall be admissible in evidence against him in criminal proceedings other than proceedings for an offence under section 36 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) or section 79, or for perjury, in respect of the answer.

If so requested by any person who is or would be affected by the exercise by the appointed person of any power under this section, the appointed person shall produce a copy of his appointment for inspection by that person.

Any costs or expenses incurred by an appointed person (other than a public officer) in conducting an inquiry under this section shall be paid out of the MPFA Administration Account established and maintained under section 6M of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485). (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 4)
An appointed person may, and if so directed by the Registrar shall, make an interim report to the Registrar and on the conclusion of the inquiry shall make a final report to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section shall be construed as requiring an authorized institution within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) to disclose any information or produce any record or other document relating to the affairs of a customer of it to the appointed person unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the disclosure or production is necessary for the purposes of the inquiry and certifies in writing that is the case,

subsection.continued: and, where the conditions in paragraphs (a) and (b) are met in respect of any such institution, such institution shall comply with any provision of subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: Any person who without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in answering a question put to him under subsection (5)(c) says anything which is false in a material particular and which he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: knows to be false in such particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has no reasonable ground to believe to be true in such particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.(Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.content: Where the domicile of a registered scheme changes, the designated person of the scheme shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, supply to the Registrar particulars in writing of the change.

Where the Registrar receives particulars referred to in subsection (1), he may by notice in writing require the relevant designated person to make, within such period as is specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice), an application in writing to him to have another submission described in paragraph 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 substituted for the submission accepted when the application for the registration of the relevant registered scheme was allowed.

Where the Registrar disallows an application made under subsection (2) relating to a registered scheme and he is satisfied that the domicile of the scheme has changed, he may issue a proposal under section 42 to cancel the registration of the scheme.
Where the Registrar allows an application under subsection (2), he shall record the change of domicile in the register. (Added 53 of 1995 s. 18)

section.name: s38
section.heading: New trustee to give undertaking
section.leadIn: Where any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: (in the case of an individual) is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong and is the holder of an identity card within the meaning of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (in the case of a body corporate) has a place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has not given an undertaking which is in force for the time being as regards a registered scheme governed by a trust,

section.continued: is appointed as a trustee of the trust, he shall within 28 days after such appointment send to the Registrar an undertaking stating that he undertakes to perform in relation to the scheme the functions imposed or conferred on a designated person by this Ordinance.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Death etc. of designated person etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar reasonably believes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the designated person of a registered scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has died;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is incapacitated;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: cannot be contacted; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: refuses or neglects to act as such designated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in case there is more than one such designated person, each of them—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has died;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is incapacitated;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: cannot be contacted; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: refuses or neglects to act as such designated person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in case such designated person is a body of persons (whether incorporated or unincorporated), it is being or has been wound up or has otherwise ceased to exist or refuses or neglects to act as such designated person,

subsection.continued: he may, by notice in writing given to the relevant employer or administrator of the scheme or such other person as he considers appropriate, require necessary steps to be taken within such period as is specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice) to have the designated person replaced.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar reasonably believes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person by whom a submission described in paragraph 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 was made as regards a registered scheme has died or is incapacitated or cannot be contacted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case there is more than one such person, each of them has died or is incapacitated or cannot be contacted; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in case the person is a body of persons (whether incorporated or unincorporated), it is being or has been wound up or has otherwise ceased to exist,

subsection.continued: he may by notice in writing given to the designated person of the scheme require to be made to him within such period as is specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice) an application in writing to substitute another submission for the relevant submission (as defined in subsection (6)).

subsection.content: Where the Registrar gives a notice to a person under subsection (1) as regards a registered scheme, the person shall within the period specified in the notice lodge with the Registrar an undertaking described in section 15(f) and relating to the scheme given by such person as the Registrar may consider suitable.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application is made in respect of a registered scheme under subsection (2), the application shall be allowed if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is accompanied by a submission described in paragraph 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 and relating to the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that such submission is in an appropriate form and the person making the submission is a suitable person to make it.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receives an undertaking relating to a registered scheme under subsection (3), the person who gives the undertaking shall thenceforth become the designated person of the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allows an application relating to a registered scheme made under subsection (2), the submission shall thenceforth take the place of the relevant submission (as defined in subsection (6)) as regards the scheme for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.def: In relation to an application under this section, the relevant submission (有關願受管轄書) means the submission to jurisdiction accepted by the Registrar when the application for registration of the relevant registered scheme was allowed.

subsection.content: The Registrar may on an application in writing by a person who has given an undertaking referred to in section 15(f), 38 or 39(3) release such person from the undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person makes an application under subsection (1) in respect of a registered scheme and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is for the time being the only designated person of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the scheme is governed by a trust and the applicant has ceased or will cease acting as a trustee of the trust) the terms of the relevant trust instrument require appointment of a trustee to replace the applicant,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall not allow the application unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the application is accompanied by a new undertaking described in section 15(f) and relating to the scheme; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the person giving the new undertaking is a suitable person to give it.

subsection.content: Where the Registrar allows an application under subsection (2), the person who gives the new undertaking shall thenceforth take the place of the applicant as the designated person of the relevant registered scheme.

A person who has made a submission described in paragraph 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 may apply in writing to the Registrar to release him from the submission and substitute for it a submission by another person.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person makes an application under subsection (1) in respect of a registered scheme and he is for the time being the only person who made the submission in respect of the scheme, the Registrar shall not allow the application unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is accompanied by a submission described in paragraph 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 and relating to the same scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the submission is in an appropriate form and the person proposing to make the submission is a suitable person to make it.

subsection.content: Where the Registrar allows an application made under subsection (1) relating to a registered scheme, the submission which accompanied the application shall thenceforth, as regards the scheme, for the purposes of this Ordinance take the place of the submission accepted by the Registrar when the application for registration of such scheme was allowed or, in case the applicant is one of the persons who made the original submission, take the place of such submission to the extent it was made by the applicant.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Grounds for cancellation of registration
section.leadIn: Where in relation to a registered scheme it appears to the Registrar that—

paragraph.name: aa
a
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 20 is not complied with;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 20A(1), (2) or (3) is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirement of section 21 is not complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 24 is not complied with;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any requirement under section 26(1) is not complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 27 is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the requirement of section 28(3) is not complied with;

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: a notice has been given under section 29(1); (Added 53 of 1995 s. 19)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 30(1) or (2) is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the requirement of section 31 is not complied with;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any requirement under section 32(1) is not complied with;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any requirement under section 33(1) or (1A) is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the requirement of section 37(1) is not complied with;

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: a notice has been given under section 39(1) and no undertaking was given to the Registrar in accordance with section 39(3);

paragraph.name: n
na
paragraph.content: any requirement of section 67(2)(gab) is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: nb
paragraph.content: the requirement of section 70B is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: on information available to him the cancellation of the registration of the scheme will be in the interests of the members of the scheme as a whole; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: any term of the scheme allows a person other than an eligible person to be a member of the scheme; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: not all members of the scheme are eligible persons; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: the scheme is not, or has ceased to be, an occupational retirement scheme; or (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the cancellation of the registration of the scheme is in the public interest, (Added 9 of 2020 s. 27)

section.continued: the Registrar may issue a proposal to cancel registration of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar issues a proposal to cancel registration of a registered scheme under section 42, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice containing the proposal in a way the Registrar considers appropriate; and (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a notice in writing of the proposal to the relevant employer and designated person of the scheme requiring the employer to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Registrar’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice published or given by the Registrar under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the reason for issuing the proposal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that representations or objections may be made as regards the proposed cancellation to the Registrar within such period (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date of the notice) as shall be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may on an application in writing in his absolute discretion—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw any proposal issued under section 42; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extend the period referred to in subsection (2).

subsection.content: Where the court has made an order as regards a registered scheme under section 44(1) and the Registrar withdraws a proposal as regards the scheme under subsection (3), he shall make an application under section 44(3)(a) for the withdrawal of the order.
A person who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3. (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 28)

section.name: s44
section.heading: Court may order freezing of assets

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar issues, or intends to issue, a proposal to cancel the registration of a registered scheme under section 42, the court may on an application by the Registrar order that— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the assets of the scheme shall not be assigned, transferred or otherwise disposed of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no payment out of the assets of the scheme shall be made, whether to a member or otherwise,

subsection.continued: except in accordance with the court order.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Before making an order under subsection (1), the court must satisfy itself, so far as it can reasonably do so, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable that the order be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the order will not unfairly prejudice any person. (Added 9 of 2020 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: Any—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: asset assigned, transferred or disposed of; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payment made out of the assets of the relevant registered scheme,

subsection.continued: in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) shall be recoverable by such person and, after being so recovered, disposed of in such manner as the court may specify in the order.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1) as regards a registered scheme shall cease to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is withdrawn by the court upon an application by the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (Where an appeal is made under section 46 against the cancellation of the registration of the scheme) if the Appeal Board directs the Registrar to restore the registration of the scheme under section 62(4)(d); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: upon the making of a winding up order (if any) under section 48(2) as regards the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the period during which representations or objections may be made has expired;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than 2 months have expired since the date of such notice; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the Registrar, having considered the representations or objections (if any) made as regards the proposed cancellation, is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: a condition imposed under section 18(4A), or amended under section 18(4B), in respect of the scheme is not complied with; (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 20 is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: 1b
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 20A(1), (2) or (3) is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirement of section 21 is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 24 has not been complied with;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a requirement under section 26(1) is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 27 is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the requirement of section 28(3) is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: 6a
subparagraph.content: a notice has been given under section 29(1); (Added 53 of 1995 s. 20)

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 30(1) or (2) is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the requirement of section 31 is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: a requirement under section 32(1) is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: any requirement under section 33(1) or (1A) is not complied with; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: the requirement of section 37(1) is not complied with;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: a notice has been given under section 37(2) and no application was made under that section as regards the scheme or that an application made under that section is refused;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: a notice has been given under section 39(1) and no undertaking was given to the Registrar in accordance with section 39(3);

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: a notice has been given under section 39(2) and no application was made under that section as regards the scheme; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: 14a
subparagraph.content: any requirement of section 67(2)(gab) is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: 14b
subparagraph.content: the requirement of section 70B is not complied with; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: xv
subparagraph.content: the cancellation of the registration of the scheme will be in the interests of the members of the scheme as a whole; (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 30)
not all members of the scheme are eligible persons; (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)
the scheme is not, or has ceased to be, an occupational retirement scheme; or (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)
the cancellation of the registration of the scheme is in the public interest, (Added 9 of 2020 s. 30)

subsection.continued: the Registrar may cancel the registration of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar cancels the registration of a registered scheme under subsection (1), he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a written notice of the cancellation in a way the Registrar considers appropriate; and (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 30)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a notice in writing to the relevant employer of the scheme requiring him to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Registrar’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice published or given by the Registrar under subsection (2) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision of the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that appeal against the cancellation may be made by the relevant employer of the scheme to the Appeal Board within 2 months after the date of the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation will come into effect.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (2)(b)(i) or (ii) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3. (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 30)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Appeal against cancellation
section.content: Where the Registrar cancels the registration of a registered scheme under section 45(1), the relevant employer of the scheme may, within 2 months after the date of the notice given under section 45(2)(b), appeal to the Appeal Board against the cancellation.

subsection.leadIn: A cancellation under section 45(1) shall not come into effect—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where such an appeal is made, pending determination of the appeal or, in case such appeal is withdrawn, before such withdrawal.

subsection.content: Where the Registrar cancels the registration of a registered scheme, in order to afford an opportunity to enable the requirement of or under this Ordinance which caused him to cancel the registration to be complied with, he may defer the coming into effect of the cancellation and if so, shall give a notice in writing of deferment to the designated person and relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice of the coming into effect of the cancellation in a way the Registrar considers appropriate; and (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 31)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a notice in writing of the coming into effect of the cancellation to the relevant employer of the relevant scheme requiring him to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Registrar’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (3)(b)(i) or (ii) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3. (Replaced 9 of 2020 s. 31)

section.name: s48
section.heading: Application for winding up of Hong Kong domiciled schemes

subsection.content: Where the Registrar cancels the registration of a Hong Kong domiciled scheme, the Registrar, the relevant employer of the scheme or any member of the scheme may apply to the court to exercise its power under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Upon an application made under subsection (1) the court may, if it considers it just and equitable to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the scheme to be wound up in accordance with a proposal submitted by the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order the scheme to be wound up in accordance with a proposal so submitted but modified in a manner specified by the court; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: order the scheme to be wound up by the court.

subsection.content: Where the court makes an order under subsection (2), the provisions of Part VII shall apply.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Winding Up of Hong Kong Domiciled Schemes

subsection.content: Where the court makes an order under section 48(2), it shall appoint a liquidator as regards the scheme being wound up for the purposes of conducting the winding up and performing related functions under this Ordinance. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 32)
The court may on an application made by the Registrar remove a liquidator from his office.
A liquidator may by notice in writing given to the Registrar of the High Court resign from his office. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)
Where the office of a liquidator becomes vacant by whatever reason, the court may appoint any other person to fill the vacancy.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Remuneration of liquidator
section.leadIn: Where a person other than a public officer is appointed liquidator as regards a scheme under section 49(1), the person is to receive such remuneration as is determined— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where there is a consultative committee formed in respect of the members of the scheme, by agreement between the liquidator and the committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is no consultative committee or the liquidator and the committee fail to agree, by the court.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Powers of liquidator
section.leadIn: A liquidator appointed as regards a scheme under section 49(1) has power— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 34)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to sell the assets of the scheme by public auction or private contract, with power to transfer the whole thereof to any person or company, or to sell the same in parcels;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (notwithstanding any term of the scheme) to bring or defend any action or other legal proceedings in the name and on behalf of the beneficiaries under the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to make any compromise or arrangement with respect to any debt, claim or liability relating to the assets of the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to engage the service of other persons to assist him in the performance of his functions;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to do such other things as may be necessary for winding up the scheme and distributing its assets.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Vesting of assets of scheme in liquidator

subsection.content: Where the court makes an order as regards a scheme under section 48(2), all the assets of the scheme shall vest thereupon in the liquidator who shall take such assets into his custody.

The court may, upon or at any time after making the order under section 48(2), require any authorized insurer, trustee, banker, agent, the relevant employer of the scheme or any other person to pay, deliver, convey, surrender or transfer within such time as the court may direct to the liquidator any money, property, books or records to which the liquidator is entitled by virtue of subsection (1).
On the appointment of a liquidator, all the powers of the administrator of the relevant scheme acting in his capacity as such shall cease.

Where the court makes an order under section 48(2) as regards a scheme whose registration was cancelled by the Registrar, the winding up of the scheme shall be deemed to have commenced on the date of the notice published under section 43(1)(a) as regards the scheme. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 36)

Any benefit which but for this subsection would become payable to a member of the scheme under the scheme on or after the commencement of the winding up shall not be payable and any such benefit which has been paid to a member shall be recoverable by the liquidator as a civil debt due to the beneficiaries under the scheme.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Avoidance of preference in certain cases
section.leadIn: Every—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: transfer of asset of a scheme; and (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 37)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: encumbrance created over such asset,

section.continued: in favour of any creditor with a view to giving such creditor (or any surety or guarantor for the debt due to such creditor) a preference over the other creditors shall, if the winding up of the scheme by virtue of a winding-up order made under section 48(2) as regards the scheme commences within 6 months after the date of such transfer or creation, be deemed fraudulent and void as against the liquidator appointed as regards the scheme.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Saving of bona fide transactions, etc.
section.leadIn: Nothing in sections 52, 53 and 54 shall invalidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any payment of benefit to a member of a scheme under the scheme before the commencement of the winding up of the scheme; or (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 38)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any bona fide contract, dealing or transaction made over any asset of the scheme for valuable consideration.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), the assets of a scheme subject to a winding-up order made under section 48(2) are on its winding up to be applied by the liquidator in satisfaction of its liabilities as at the date on which the winding up commenced pari passu. (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: The assets remaining after payment of the actual expenses incurred in realizing any of the assets of the scheme shall be applied in satisfaction of the following liabilities, which shall be satisfied in the following order of priority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remuneration of and expenses incurred by the liquidator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: liabilities to general creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (unless the terms of the scheme otherwise provide) vested liabilities to the beneficiaries of the scheme as at the date on which the relevant winding-up order is made; and
