subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that such scheme is the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: that paragraphs (a) to (d) of section 2(4) apply in respect of the pooling agreement which (where the scheme to which the application relates is an existing scheme) applies or (where such scheme is a proposed scheme) will apply to the scheme to which the application relates;

paragraph.name: d
da

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: provide that where an alteration described in sub-subparagraph (i) occurs, any vested benefit which the member concerned is entitled to receive as at the date of such alteration under the terms of the scheme as if the condition precedent (if any) of such entitlement had been satisfied shall, if he so elects, become payable to him; (Amended 59 of 1993 s. 24)

b

iii

section.name: s3A
section.content: A statement by the applicant stating that all members of the scheme are eligible persons.

section.name: s4
section.content: (Where the occupational retirement scheme to which the application relates is an existing scheme) a set of audited accounts (if any) prepared in respect of the scheme in relation to the latest financial year of the scheme (which financial year shall end on a date not more than 9 months before the date of the application for registration of the scheme).

section.name: s1
section.heading: Where the scheme to which the application relates is a proposed defined benefit scheme
section.leadIn: A certificate issued by an actuary within the 2 months prior to the date of the receipt of the application which shall either be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a full certificate certifying that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he has given an initial actuarial valuation as regards the proposed scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he has made recommendations to the relevant employer of the scheme on the financial implications of the scheme (specifying in particular what would, in his opinion, be the level of contributions required to cover liabilities, including contingent and prospective liabilities, under the scheme when implemented);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: following the valuation he has received from that employer a copy of that employer’s written undertaking to the proposed administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with the recommendations; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: provided the scheme is funded in accordance with his recommendations, he would expect that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability on the establishment of the scheme and remain sufficient to meet such liability throughout the period of 3 years from the date of the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: (in the case of a proposed scheme the proposed date of establishment of which is earlier than the 5th anniversary of the commencement* of section 1) a qualified certificate certifying that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he has given an initial actuarial valuation as regards the proposed scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he has made recommendations to the relevant employer of the scheme on the financial implications of the scheme (specifying in particular what would, in his opinion, be the level of contributions required to cover liabilities, including contingent and prospective liabilities, under the scheme when implemented);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: following the valuation he has received from that employer a copy of that employer’s written undertaking to the proposed administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with the recommendations; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: he does not expect that on the establishment of the scheme the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet its aggregate vested liability but, providing that the scheme is funded in accordance with his recommendations— (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he would expect that, on the date on which a period specified in the certificate would expire (which period shall be specified to expire on or before the 5th anniversary of the commencement* of section 1), the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: what he would expect to be the amount, if any, of the shortfall between the scheme’s assets and the scheme’s aggregate vested liability as at the date of the actuarial review covered by the first actuarial certificate to be supplied under section 31(1); and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Where the scheme to which the application relates is a defined benefit scheme existing at the time of application
section.leadIn: A certificate issued by an actuary relating to the last actuarial review conducted as regards the scheme as at a date which shall not be more than 9 months before the date of the application for registration of the scheme, which certificate shall either be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a full certificate certifying that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an actuarial review has been conducted as regards the scheme as of the date specified in the certificate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the course of the review he has had regard to the financial condition of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the review included a valuation of the scheme’s liabilities (including contingent and prospective liabilities);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: as at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: following the review he has made recommendations as regards funding of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: following the review he has received a copy of a written undertaking by the relevant employer of the scheme to the administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with those recommendations; and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.leadIn: provided the scheme is funded in accordance with those recommendations, he would expect that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the scheme’s assets would continue to be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability throughout the period of 3 years from the date of the review; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: (for a scheme existing immediately before 15 October 1993) a qualified certificate certifying— (Amended 9 of 2020 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that an actuarial review has been conducted as regards the scheme as of the date specified in the certificate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that in the course of the review he has had regard to the financial condition of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the review included a valuation of the scheme’s liabilities (including contingent and prospective liabilities);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were not sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability, and stating the amount of the shortfall as at such date; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: although as at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability, he would not expect that the scheme’s assets would continue to be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability throughout the period of 3 years from the date of the review;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: that following the review he has made recommendations as regards funding of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: that following the review he has received a copy of a written undertaking by the relevant employer of the scheme to the administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with those recommendations; and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.leadIn: provided the scheme is funded in accordance with those recommendations— (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: what he would expect to be the amount of the shortfall between the scheme’s assets and the scheme’s aggregate vested liability as at the expiry of 12 months from the date of the review;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that he would expect that, on the date on which a period specified in the certificate would expire (which period shall be specified to expire on a day which is earlier than the 5th anniversary of the commencement* of section 1), the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: that on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Where the scheme to which the application relates is stated to be an offshore scheme

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A submission to the jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance in writing to the extent requisite to enable the Court of First Instance to exercise in relation to the scheme the jurisdiction conferred by section 74. The submission is to be made by or on behalf of the trustee or (in case there is no trustee) such other person and in such form as the Registrar may direct.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A statement by a solicitor stating that the terms of the scheme have the effect provided for in section 18(1)(d).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Where the scheme to which the application relates is stated to be an offshore scheme governed by a trust
section.content: A statement by a person qualified to practise as a professional legal practitioner in the country, territory or place stated to be the domicile of the scheme whether or not the trust instrument in his opinion requires (whether expressly or in effect) that the relevant employer of the scheme or his associate cannot act as the sole trustee of the trust.

part.name: P1
part.leadIn: A full certificate issued by the actuary shall certify that—

subsection.content: An actuarial review has been conducted as regards the scheme as of the date specified in the certificate.
In the course of the review he has had regard to the financial condition of the scheme.
The review included a valuation of the scheme’s liabilities (including contingent and prospective liabilities).
As at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability.
Following the review he has made recommendations as regards funding of the scheme.

Following the review he has received a copy of a written undertaking by the relevant employer of the scheme to the administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with those recommendations.

subsection.leadIn: Provided the scheme is funded in accordance with those recommendations, he would expect that—

subsection.name: a
b
subsection.content: on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability.

part.name: P2
part.leadIn: A qualified certificate issued by the actuary shall certify—

subsection.content: That an actuarial review has been conducted as regards the scheme as of the date specified in the certificate.
That in the course of the review he has had regard to the financial condition of the scheme.
That the review included a valuation of the scheme’s liabilities (including contingent and prospective liabilities).

subsection.leadIn: That—

subsection.name: a
subsection.def: as at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were not sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability and stating the amount of the shortfall as at such date (the current shortfall); or (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: although as at the date of the review the scheme’s assets were sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability, he would not expect that the scheme’s assets would continue to be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability throughout the period of 3 years from the date of the review.
That following the review he has made recommendations as regards funding of the scheme.

That following the review he has received a copy of a written undertaking by the relevant employer of the scheme to the administrator of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with those recommendations.

subsection.leadIn: Provided the scheme is funded in accordance with those recommendations—

subsection.name: a
subsection.def: what he would expect to be the amount of the shortfall between the scheme’s assets and the scheme’s aggregate vested liability as at the expiry of 12 months from the date of the review (the expected shortfall); (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: that he would expect that within a period being the later of the 5th anniversary of the commencement* of section 1 and 3 years from the date of the review, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet its aggregate vested liability; and

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: that he would also expect that on the expiration of the period specified in subparagraph (b), or on the expiration of a period, where necessary, specified in the certificate, the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate past service liability.

subsection.leadIn: (Where the immediately preceding certificate supplied in accordance with this Ordinance was a qualified certificate)—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: that the amount of contributions recommended in the certificate to be made in the remainder of the period specified in that preceding certificate is not less than the amount of contributions recommended in that preceding certificate to be made in the same period; or

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: that the amount of contributions recommended in the certificate to be made in the remainder of the period specified in that preceding certificate is less than the amount of contributions recommended in that preceding certificate to be made in the same period, but he would expect that even with such lesser amount of contributions the scheme’s assets would be sufficient to meet the scheme’s aggregate vested liability as at the expiry of 12 months from the date of the review.

subsection.leadIn: (Where the immediately preceding certificate supplied in accordance with this Ordinance was a qualified certificate and where owing to any reason, other than the failure of the relevant employer of the scheme to contribute to the scheme’s funds in accordance with the actuarial recommendations in that preceding certificate, the current shortfall as stated in the certificate exceeds the expected shortfall as stated in that preceding certificate)—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: what in the actuary’s opinion were the major reasons giving rise to such excess;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: that the amount of contributions recommended to be made in the certificate includes additional contributions which the actuary considers are required to cover such excess.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Information to be Contained in a Statement under Section 35

section.name: s1
section.content: Descriptions of the pensions, allowances and other benefits payable under the relevant registered scheme and in case more than one class or description of pension, allowance or other benefit is payable, particulars of those classes or descriptions of pension, allowance or other benefit.

section.name: s2
section.content: Particulars of the scheme’s provisions regarding eligibility for membership of the scheme.

section.name: s3
section.content: Particulars of the circumstances (if any) in which under such scheme a member will lose or may be liable to lose his entitlement to benefit under the scheme wholly or partly.

section.name: s4
section.content: Particulars of the circumstances (if any) in which a right which has accrued under such scheme may be affected to a member’s detriment.

section.name: s5
section.content: A copy of the scheme instrument as amended from time to time together with (in case the scheme is governed by a trust) a copy of the trust instrument or (in case the scheme is the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement) a copy of the policy.

section.name: s6
section.content: A copy of the statement of accounts and report (if any) thereon most recently prepared and audited pursuant to section 20.

section.name: s7
section.content: A copy of the most recent actuarial certificate (if any) relating to such scheme and sent to the Registrar in compliance with a requirement of or made under this Ordinance.
